doc.previous: Some Seminoles remained, and the U.S. Army arrived in Florida, leading to the Second Seminole War (1835â42). Following the war, approximately 3,000 Seminole and 800 Black Seminole were removed to Indian Territory. A few hundred Seminole remained in Florida in the Everglades.
doc.after: On March 3, 1845, Florida became the 27th state of the United States of America.[16] The state was admitted as a slave state, although initially its population grew slowly.
